intro: Sechiopsis distincta, commonly known as the distinct leaf sechiopsis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are deeply divided into five to seven lobes. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Sechiopsis distincta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
